All holes, cracks or worn concrete should be patched with Sealocrete Sealoflor up to the level of the existing floor and allowed to set, before the main Cempolay Floor Levelling Compound is applied. In hot conditions continue to keep the surface damp, but ensure free water does not remain on the surface. Pour the mixed Cempolay Floor Levelling Compound onto the substrate and spread to the required thickness using a float. Allow at least 16 hours to elapse, then ensure the Cempolay Floor Levelling Compound has hardened before applying the flooring adhesive. If application of the floor covering is delayed and especially in warm or drying weather, the floor should be damped down periodically. name: Dryrod Damp Proofing Rods (10 Pack) - Next Generation Rising Damp Treatment from The Makers of Dryzone
description:
Dryrods Deliver the Correct Dose Every Time
Traditional rising damp treatment methods utilise cream or liquid injection. These methods can be prone to operator error leading to under-treatment and DPC failure. Due to their unique patented design, Dryrod Damp-Proofing Rods deliver the correct dose of active ingredient every time.
Extensively Tested and Internationally Approved
Laboratory testing has proven that Dryrod Damp-Proofing Rods out-perform competing treatment methods, even in highly-saturated walls and freezing temperatures. They have also been approved by the British Board of Agrement and the German WTA organization.
100% Active Ingredient for Maximum Water Repellency
It is not possible to infuse 100% pure active ingredient into a traditional Damp-Proofing Cream. Thanks to their unique fibre rods, Dryrod Damp-Proofing Rods are saturated with 100% silane/siloxane. Only the pure active ingredient diffuses into the wall, in a controlled dose that ensures consistent application. Cheaper creams may seem more attractive, but they often only contain around 25%-50% active ingredient. They cannot out-perform Dryrod.Guarantee - StatutoryFeatures and benefitsDryrod Damp-Proofing Rods are patented fibre rods that carry a powerful water-repellent material. They are simply inserted into holes drilled at regular intervals along a mortar course. Once inserted, the rods diffuse their water-repellent material along the mortar course, curing to form an effective barrier to rising damp.

They have been scientifically proven to eliminate rising damp even in highly-saturated walls. This performance has also been internationally tested and approved.Dryrod Damp-Proofing Rods Next Generation DPC - The most effective form of damp proofing for walls; outperforms creams, gels or liquids.Fast & Simple to Install DIY rising damp treatment.
